situation.title: Slovakia
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for the people arriving to and departing from Slovakia.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

From 17.2.2021 onwards, it is necessary to register on the way from the Czech Republic to Slovakia and enter the quarantine, which can be completed no earlier than the 8th day by a negative PCR test or without the test after 14 days with an asymptomatic course.

A complete exception from these measures have, for example, international transport drivers and EU citizens who transit through Slovakia (within 8 hours).

Exceptions from registration and quarantine are also available to cross-border workers, students, artists or those who have to provide urgent care to a close family member. However, they must submit a negative PCR or antigen test that is not older than 7 days.

More informations can be found at the Czech embassy in Bratislava websites (only in Czech).

Following rules are still valid:

People arriving in Slovakia from the Czech Republic must have a negative PCR or antigene test max. 72 hours old. As an alternative, they can register via the e-border form, enter domestic quarantine, and get tested at least 5 days after the arrival.

Cross-border workers, students, artists, etc. must have a negative test not older than 14 days; use both antigen and PCR test.

The complete exemption from the negative test obligation apply to people transiting or international transport drivers.

Before traveling to Slovakia, we recommend that you read the information on currently valid measures in the Slovak Republic, which are clearly published on the website of the Ministry of Health of the Slovak Republic (English page is curently under maintenance - 15.2.2020, Slovak version is available) and also on the Quarantine Measures and Travel website.

Return from Slovakia

From 5.2.2021, Slovakia is on the list of countries with a very high risk of infection (dark red). If you are returning to the Czech Republic from Slovakia, the following obligations are being applied to you: 

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronical form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

There are exceptions to these conditions. It does not apply, for example, to transit within 12 hours, international transport workers (holders of the certification), children under 5, cross-border workers and students (certified as a worker or student), for those Czech citizens who have undergone covid-19 in the last 90 days and had an isolation ( with a certificate from a doctor) and for family members, companions of Czech citizens traveling with a Czech citizen, who have a diplomatic note issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (certificate of covid-19 disease and isolation in a red or dark red country). Additional exceptions can be found in the current measure. 

For travel from all three groups of countries (orange, red, dark red), it is mandatory to wear an FFP2 respirator or at least a medical veil for 10 days after arrival in the Czech Republic.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found in English clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

More details can be found here.
